page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Formal local historical publications hardly exist for the Eakring and Bilsthorpe area. A paper with particular reference to Bilsthorpe was included in the Transactions of the Thoroton Society for 1958. Recent mining history from Bilsthorpe has been included in Wallers's "The Dukeries Transformed". The development of Eakring's oilfield appeared in "The Secret of Sherwood Forest" by Woodward. Currently Eakring research is advanced and should lead to publication, but the mediaeval period requires further investigation. A photographic collection relevant to Eakring's history is in formation and family history records for the village are being compiled. An Eakring site connected with the celebrated 17th century Rector William Mompesson has been renovated and signposted.
